page.title: 01WAKEFIELD - CATHEDRAL CITY
page.content: {Wakefield}is the administrative capital of{West Yorkshire.}It has many fine buildings dominated by the {Cathedral Church of All Saints,}the spire of which is the highest in Yorkshire at a height of 75 metres. Wakefield was granted its city charter in 1888 but it had been an important market town for many centuries before that.{The County Hall, Law Courts, {Town Hall and Museum}are all close to one another on Wood Street. There is also a{Chantry Chapel}on Kirkgate Bridge as it crosses the{River Calder on the main southerly exit from the city. There are several hospitals, the most famous of which is probably Pinderfields the home of the Regional Burns Unit and School of Remedial Gymnasts. It has open and indoor markets and the main shopping area has recently been pedestrianised.
